page.title: 02FISHING IN PORTHLEVEN
page.content: Fishing is popular in Porthleven. There are many people fishing but not as many as long ago. In those days you could walk across the harbour by jumping from boat to boat. Today in summer there are approximately forty fishing boats in the harbour, but in winter there are only about six. The majority of larger fishing boats use echo sounders, Decca navigators and radio telephones. The echo sounders not only find the fish but tell you how large the shoal is. There are no trawlers and all the boats fish in inshore waters. They catch mackerel with feathers. This is called whiffing and they use nets to catch cod, ling, dogfish, conger eel and pollock. The fish caught are mainly sold in Newlyn but a few go to the local fish merchant.
